Package com.metal.kit.vapor.characters

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
com.metal.kit.vapor.characters.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Represents an inventory containing a list of weapons. The inventory allows adding, removing, and accessing weapons. It also keeps track of the total number of weapons in the inventory.

The inventory is managed through an ArrayList of Weapon objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      Constructs a new empty inventory.

      Initializes an empty list of weapons, ready to store Weapon objects.

  • Method Details

    • addWeapon

      public void addWeapon(Weapon weapon)
      Adds a weapon to the inventory.

      This method allows you to add a weapon to the inventory list.

      Parameters:
      weapon - The weapon to be added to the inventory.

    • getWeapon

      public Weapon getWeapon(int index)
      Retrieves a weapon from the inventory by its index.

      This method allows you to access a specific weapon in the inventory using its index.

      Parameters:
      index - The index of the weapon to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The weapon at the specified index, or null if the index is invalid (out of bounds of the list).

    • getWeapons

      public ArrayList<Weapon> getWeapons()
      Retrieves the full list of weapons currently in the inventory.

      This method returns the complete list of weapons in the inventory.

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Weapon objects representing all weapons in the inventory.

    • removeWeapon

      public void removeWeapon(int index)
      Removes a weapon from the inventory by its index.

      This method allows you to remove a weapon from the inventory and prints a message confirming the removal of the weapon.

      Parameters:
      index - The index of the weapon to be removed.

    • getWeaponCount

      public int getWeaponCount()
      Retrieves the number of weapons in the inventory.

      This method returns the total number of weapons stored in the inventory.

      Returns:
      The total number of weapons in the inventory.

    • hasWeapon

      public boolean hasWeapon(Weapon weapon)
      Checks whether the inventory contains a specific weapon.

      This method checks if the inventory contains a given weapon.

      Currently, this method always returns true, as the actual logic for checking the presence of a weapon is not implemented. This method could be extended to return a result based on the weapon provided.

      Parameters:
      weapon - The weapon to check for in the inventory.
      Returns:
      true if the inventory contains the specified weapon. (Currently, the logic always returns true, but it can be extended in future implementations.)
